translated: Description. The Gorakṣaguṭikā, the magic pill of Gorakṣa, is attributed to Gorakṣa alias Gorakṣanātha, the famous founder of Haṭha Yoga. The colophons state that it is part of the Kalpadrumvivekinī and that it is a commentary on the Bhāṣya on Yoga. It is framed in the format of a Tantra as a dialogue between Śiva and Gaurī. Although Gorakṣanātha was a yogi, as are his followers the Nāth Yogīs today, and should not be concerned with ritual practice, in fact the Nāth tradition has developed an extensive liturgy centered on the worship of its gurus. This short tract contains a series of hymns (stotra) praising Gorakṣanātha and myths that narrate their origins.
